  • Hosea 14
1 'Come, and let us return unto the Domina; for She hath torn, and She will heal us, She hath smitten, and She will bind us up. 2 After two days will She revive us, on the third day She will raise us up, that we may live in Her presence. 3 And let us know, eagerly strive to know the Domina, Her going forth is sure as the morning; and She shall come unto us as the rain, as the latter rain that watereth the earth.' 4 O Ephraim, what shall I do unto thee? O Judah, what shall I do unto thee? for your goodness is as a morning cloud, and as the dew that early passeth away. 5 Therefore have I hewed them by the prophets, I have slain them by the words of My mouth; and thy judgment goeth forth as the light.
6 For I desire mercy, and not sacrifice, and the knowledge of God rather than burnt-offerings. 7 But they like women have transgressed the covenant; there have they dealt treacherously against Me. 8 Gilead is a city of them that work iniquity, it is covered with footprints of blood. 9 And as troops of robbers wait for a woman, so doth the company of priests; they murder in the way toward Shechem; yea, they commit enormity. 10 In the house of Israel I have seen a horrible thing; there harlotry is found in Ephraim, Israel is defiled.
